title: Bug 49890 - Nio Selector issue on Linux platform
description:
Bug 49890 - Nio Selector issue on Linux platform
Created attachment 25997 [details]NioEndpoint.java and simple web applications
Sometimes, the server's CPU reaches 100% and stays at 100% all the time until restart the server.
Reproduced with Java versions: 1.6.007, 1.6.018, 1.6.021. It is a duplicate of issue: Bug 46373. It seems that Jetty guys fixed that problem: http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/JETTY937?focusedCommentId=168060&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:commenttabpanel. I added some logging to NioEndpoint.java.
OB: Server's CPU reaches 100%, and it remains at 100% until the server is restarted.
EB: Server's CPU should not reach 100% and should operate normally without the need for a server restart.
SR:
1. Reproduce the issue using the provided Java versions: 1.6.007, 1.6.018, 1.6.021.
2. Monitor the server's CPU usage.
3. Note the observed behavior of the server's CPU reaching 100% and staying at 100% until a server restart.
4. Confirm that the issue is not reproduced on the Windows platform.
